xwikidoc.name: WebHome
xwikidoc.creator: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: Translation Wiki
xwikidoc.content:
This wiki is used to internationalize all the projects of the [[XWiki Ecosystem>>http://xwiki.org]] (XWiki Platform, XWiki Rendering, extensions, etc). It is meant to be a collaborative platform where everyone can contribute translations in a given language.
This wiki only contain translations, the default language (##en_US##) is maintained by the Core Dev Team (or the extension author for extensions) directly on git (so any correction should be done trough a pull request for it).
= Contributing =
You can help! To start adding and updating translations, please register, log in and click on the name of the application you would like to help translate in the panel on the left. Since new messages to translate can be added every day, please check regularly whether new messages are left untranslated.
See also [[Translation Rules page>>L10N.TranslationRules]] to learn more about rules of the translation for each language.
= Found a bug or want to suggest improvements ? =
The original keys and translation can't be changed directly in this wiki. Instead, you should report a problem on [[http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI]].
Have something to report about this wiki itself? Please do this on [[http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA]].
= Latest Translations =
Here are the latest translations that have been contributed.
{{include document="L10NCode.LatestTranslationsLiveTable"/}}

property.comment:
I found that "zh_TW" was added into new 2.2 package already. But I don't finish my translation yet actually. I have some questions:
1. I can't find zh_TW in "Supported Languages" on this page
2. "zh" should be renamed to "Simplify Chinese" and "zh_TW" should be named as "Tranditional Chinese" (With Taiwan's flag) 3. How can I add my temporary translation (in ApplicationResource_zh_TW.properties) into XWiki deployment for testing before formal distribution? (I can't find any ApplicationResource in XWiki package)

1. "SUPPORTED LANGUAGE" panel is not automatic actually so it's not always up to date, we need to find some time to improve this. 1. Theses are the technical identifiers used in java, we need to associate pretty names to theses ids some way. 1. The translation files are located in xwiki-core-<version>.jar package file by default, you can override it by putting your own ApplicationResource_zh_TW.properties file in WEB-INF/classes/ folder in XWiki install. You can also put your temporary translation in a translation wiki page which avoid restarting the wiki each time you modify something. See http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications for more.
Note that it's generally better to ask questions on mailing list, we will get answers a lot faster and it's easier to find for someone asking the same question.
Thanks for your remind....I will goto mailing list next time. I am new in XWiki and hope that I can contribute something more later...

I created the italian translation page for anyone interested in the italian translation of XWiki. It's merely an initial draft. Please edit, add whenever you can. Link is on the right panel on this page, SUPPORTED LANGUAGES. (http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/TranslationRules_it)

Dear Andreas Jonsson,
I want to change Xwiki into Vietnamese language. Can you help me? How to translate ?
Thanks,
I'd like a more prominent place on this site for the instructions (http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/AddALanguage)
Dear good morning, how do I do to send the translation of the language Wxiki portuges Brazil

Did you looked at http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/AddALanguage ?
Please ask question on XWiki mailing list if you need more details (see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists )
I'm working on the translation for pt_br.
